data.text:
Brave Soldiers of Padhiana

Mohinder Singh Minhas (retd. Lt Col from Indian Army)

(Family history by Mohinder Singh)

My grandfather late Sub Maj, Hony Lieut Ishar Singh OBI Bahadur class 1 belonged to village Padhiana. He was born around 1871. After the death of his father (my great grandfather) Hav Sube Singh in Waziristan, he also joined Army. He retired in1920. His last appointment was as Assist Recruiting Officer at Jallandhur Cantt. After allotment of land by the Gov't in Montgomery Distt, my grandfather shifted from Padhiana. After the Partition he came back to Padhiana for a year or so. In 1950 he settled at village Rahon where our family had been allotted land. He passed away at Rahon in 1956.

My father, late Sardar Bikram Singh, after initial schooling in Kalra and Mission School Jallandhur, studied at FC College Lahore. He was a star player of the college football team. He took up a position of a civilian clerk in ASC in World War II and later joined Punjab Jails Service. He retired as Deputy Superintendent from Central Jail Ferozepur in 1950. He expired in 1978.

My uncle Sardar Kundan Singh did diploma in civil engineering from Lucknow. He joined MES.

I may mention here that during Second World War my grandfather (sub major of 26 PunjabiÂ’s) my father and my uncle all three were in Basra.

We were six brothers. Eldest, Late Dr. Jaswant Singh was a renowned TB Specialist. He retired as Prof (full fledged) Chest Disease from Rajindra College Patiala in 1978. Next in line (elder to me) Balwant Singh retired as Major from Army in 1979.

I started from Khalsa College Amritsar in 1944 and moved to Agriculture College Lyallpore. Completed M Sc from Agriculture College Ludhiana in 1952, Joined Army and retired in December 1979.

Next to me, late Brig. Harbhajan Singh was injured twice in 1971 Bangla Desh operations. For that he got Mention -in -Despatches. It is a gallantry award. He was an instructor in the School Of Artillery Devlali, College of Combat Mhow and was Air OP pilot. He was posted at Adampur Air field in mid sixties.

Capt. Devinder Singh, next to Brig Harbhajan, passed out from TS Dufferin in 1957. He joined Merchant Navy and retired from second highest post in SCI.

Youngest of us all is Brig. Manjit Singh (retd). He was awarded Maha Veer Chakra for gallantry in Siri Lanka operations. He was commanding an Infantry Brigade there. His brigade was the first one to link up with Jafna.

During 1965 war and 1971 war we four brothers were deeply involved. Our father, Sube Singh, got War Jagir as four of his children were in Army.
